definition: to put on weight/to get fat (a sign of prosperity, so a compliment)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
good fortune/happiness/luck
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]

sentences.english: I start to look a little plump.
The 42-year-old one-time heart-throb cut a distinctly portly figure.
sentences.chinese: 當年的大衆情人如今已經42歲，身體發福。

sentences.english: Chandler realizes he's put on some weight, so he agrees to let Monica be his personal fitness trainer.
sentences.chinese: 錢德發現自己發福，答應讓莫妮卡當私人健身教練。

sentences.english: You may worry about gaining weight when you stop smoking.
sentences.chinese: 你可能會擔心一旦戒掉煙自己會“發福”。
你的愛犬越來越發福嗎？

sentences.english: A middle age spread is the result of too many times around the table.
sentences.chinese: 中年發福的原因是在你在餐桌上花費太多時間了。

definition: circumstances/fate
obese/bloated/swollen (style)/(fig.) (of an organization) oversized or overstaffed
to lose shape/to deform
resolute/definitive/categorically/absolutely
unwelcome
achieving nothing
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
to lack male offspring
to get married and have kids/to start a family
to have achieved nothing/to be a total failure/to get nowhere
dangerous/ruthless/treacherous
less capable than desirable (idiom); not as strong as one would wish/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
attitude/position (on an issue etc)
to raise eyebrows/to cast sidelong glances (expressing fear or indignation)/shocked/surprised
to leak (gas)/to be discouraged/to despair/(disparaging) pathetic/to vent one's anger/(of a tire) to be flat
